sections.analysisResultsSubtitle: Explore your data through statistical measures and visualizations

dataInput.title: Data Input
dataInput.helperText: Supports comma, space, or newline separated values
dataInput.fileUploadDescription: Click to upload or drag and drop a file
dataInput.getStartedDescription: Try one of these sample datasets to explore the statistical visualizer:

help.mean: The average value calculated by adding all numbers and dividing by count
help.median: The middle value when data is arranged in order - less affected by outliers than mean
help.standardDeviation: Measures how spread out the data is from the mean - higher values indicate more variation
help.coefficientOfVariation: Relative measure of variability (Standard Deviation รท Mean ร 100%) - useful for comparing datasets
help.minimum: The smallest value in the dataset
help.maximum: The largest value in the dataset
help.count: The total number of data points in the dataset
help.range: The difference between the maximum and minimum values
help.q1: The value below which 25% of the data falls - divides the lower half of data
help.q2: The median - 50% of data falls below this value
help.q3: The value below which 75% of the data falls - divides the upper half of data
help.iqr: Interquartile Range (Q3 - Q1) - measures the spread of the middle 50% of data, resistant to outliers

help.histogram: A histogram shows the frequency distribution of your data by grouping values into bins. The height of each bar represents how many data points fall within that range.
help.bins: Bins divide your data range into equal intervals. More bins show finer detail but may create noise; fewer bins show general patterns but may hide detail.
